Manipulating AI memory for profit: The rise of AI Recommendation Poisoning

AI 5 min read

The article discusses the growing issue of "AI Recommendation Poisoning," a strategy used to manipulate artificial intelligence systems' memory and decision-making processes for profit. This technique involves feeding AI algorithms with biased or misleading data to alter their recommendations, impacting sectors like e-commerce, social media, and content streaming. Such manipulations can lead to skewed results favoring specific products or content, ultimately driving profit for those orchestrating the poisoning. Virginia Senate Passes Bill Banning Sale of Precise Location Data

Tech 5 min read

The Virginia Senate has approved legislation prohibiting the sale of precise location data, a step aimed at enhancing consumer privacy. The bill, passed with significant backing, seeks to curb the pervasive collection and sale of detailed geographic information by data brokers and technology companies. By restricting this practice, the legislation aims to protect individuals' privacy and prevent the misuse of sensitive data. Incentive-Aware AI Safety via Strategic Resource Allocation: A Stackelberg Security Games Perspective

Security 5 min read

The article "Incentive-Aware AI Safety via Strategic Resource Allocation: A Stackelberg Security Games Perspective" discusses integrating concepts from Stackelberg security games into AI safety to address challenges in resource allocation when adversaries may exploit system vulnerabilities. By leveraging the strategic interaction model of these games, the approach aims to ensure AI systems are both robust and resilient against adversarial threats by optimizing resource distribution to fortify against potential attacks. AI 5 min read

EPIC has introduced a comprehensive model bill aimed at safeguarding minors from online harms and encouraging the design of safer online platforms. This proposed legislation focuses on enhancing privacy protection, reducing exposure to harmful content, and limiting data collection for users under the age of 18. By prioritizing the well-being and safety of young internet users, the bill seeks to establish stricter regulations on digital platforms to create a more secure online environment. SMART launches new Wearable Imaging for Transforming Elderly Care research group

Tech 5 min read

SMART, a research entity within the Singapore-MIT Alliance for Research and Technology, has initiated a new research group focused on developing wearable imaging technologies to revolutionize elderly care. This group aims to enhance the quality of life for the elderly by providing innovative solutions that allow for continuous health monitoring and early detection of potential health issues. The integration of cutting-edge imaging technologies into wearable devices is expected to facilitate better healthcare management and support for aging populations, ultimately aiming to deliver more personalized and efficient elder care solutions.

Tech 5 min read

The article "Take back control: A modern guide to mastering application control" offers a comprehensive overview of implementing effective application control strategies to enhance cybersecurity. It emphasizes the importance of application control in preventing unauthorized software from executing and protecting systems from potential threats. The guide outlines best practices for establishing robust application control policies, such as regularly updating software inventories, enforcing strict access controls, and utilizing whitelisting techniques.
